required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on May 29, 2018
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Relative Bioavailability Of Two Formulations Of Moroctocog Alfa (AF-CC)
clinical_study.official_title: An Open-Label, Randomized, Two-period Crossover Study To Compare Relative Bioavailability of Two Formulations of Moroctocog Alfa (Af-cc) In Subjects With Moderately Severe Or Severe Hemophilia A (FVIII:C </=2%)

brief_summary.textblock: This study is being conducted to compare how moroctocog alfa (AF-CC) acts in the body when administered as 2 different dose presentations. The first is the current product vials with prefilled diluent syringes and the second is a new dual-chamber syringe dose presentation.

detailed_description.textblock: This study is being conducted in order to satisfy a post-approval EMA commitment to compare the pharmacokinetics of the 2 dose presentations used in this study.

primary_outcome.measure: Single dose pharmacokinetics of moroctocog alfa (AF-CC) using noncompartmental analysis (primary PK parameters include: Cmax, AUClast, and AUCinf)

secondary_outcome.measure: Single dose pharmacokinetics of moroctocog alfa (AF-CC) using noncompartmental analysis (secondary PK parameters include: tmax, Î»z, t1/2, CL, Vss, and FVIII Recovery)

arm_group.description: Subjects randomized to receive Treatment A during Period 1, then Treatment B during Period 2.
Subjects randomized to receive Treatment B during Period 1, then Treatment B during Period 2.

intervention.description: Treatment A: 3000 IU moroctocog alfa (AF-CC) dual chamber syringe (including diluent); Treatment B: 1000 IU + 2000 IU moroctocog alfa (AF-CC) vials and separate diluent syringes
Treatment B: 1000 IU + 2000 IU moroctocog alfa (AF-CC) vials and separate diluent syringes; Treatment A: 3000 IU moroctocog alfa (AF-CC) dual chamber syringe (including diluent)

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Male patients at least 18 years old with severe or moderately severe hemophilia A (facto VIII concentration less than or equal to 2%).
- Negative test for facto VIII inhibitor.
- If applicable, HIV or hepatitis treatment is stable at the time of enrollment.
- Ability to abstain from use of FVIII products for 72 hours at a time.
Exclusion Criteria:
- History of any positive test result for factor VIII inhibitor.
- Presence of any bleeding disorder in addition to Hemophilia A.
- Body weight less than 50 kg.
- History of alcoholism.
- Treatment with investigational drug or device within 30 days prior to the Screening visit.
